meanings.definition: A soft, sucking sound made when pressure is applied to liquid or mud.
meanings.sent1: The squelch of the mud under his boots echoed in the quiet forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard a squelch as I stepped on the wet ground.
meanings.sent3: The squelch of the ketchup bottle made everyone laugh at the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The squelch of the sponge soaking up the spilled milk was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent5: The squelch of the wet sponge against the window was a soothing sound.

meanings.sent1: She tried to squelch her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to squelch the students' chatter to start the lesson.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't squelch his excitement when he saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The loud music squelched any chance of a peaceful study session.
meanings.sent5: The boss's stern look squelched any further discussion in the meeting.

meanings.definition: To walk through mud or water with a sucking sound.
meanings.sent1: The kids squelched through the muddy field on their way to the pond.
meanings.sent2: We squelched along the path after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The puppy squelched happily through the puddles in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The hikers squelched through the marsh, trying to avoid the deeper spots.
meanings.sent5: She squelched through the flooded street in her rain boots.
